jobDescription: Company  The Boeing Company  Job ID ********* Date posted 06/13/2018 Location  Seal Beach California United States Job Description The Boeing Company is seeking a Flight Technical Data Engineer (Mid-Level) to provide customer support within Boeing Commercial Airplanes Services in Seal Beach, CA. POSITION RESPONSIBLITIES: Analyzes engineering data as related to flight crew operations procedures, operations manuals, checklists, and flight operations data; designs and develops flight operations data and documents; evaluates detailed engineering information, drawings and supplier data, and assists with the integration into engineering and operational data packages for flight crews.  Assist with engineering research for customer specific requirements and  resolution of customer problems; assists with the conversion of engineering data into the flight operations data used by flight crews.  Assists with engineering research in support of customer specific requirements, problems, and concerns.  Assists with the evaluation of customer digital data and publishing system's needs.  Relocation Assistance, based on Eligibility.  Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial airplanes and defense, space and security systems. We are engineers and technicians. Skilled scientists and thinkers. Bold innovators and dreamers. Join us, and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world.  Division  BCA Engineering  Relocation Assistance Available  Yes. Available for eligible candidates, if authorized. Qualifications This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a US Person as defined by 22 C.F.R. 120.15 is required. US Person includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee. Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience): Bachelor's degree is required  3 or more years of experience working around live aircraft and flight operations Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience): The ideal candidate will typically have at least 5 to10 years' experience in support of aerospace products, which should include commercial or military airplane flight operations. Typical Education/ Experience: Degree and typical experience in engineering classification: Bachelor's and 5 or more years' experience, Master's degree with 3 or more years' experience or PhD degree with experience. Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry. ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.  Experience Level  Individual Contributor  Job Type  Standard  Travel  No  Contingent Upon Program Award  No  Union  No  Job Code GKF5P3
